articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli military strikes on Jabalia, Beit Hanoun and Beit Lahiya have killed around 800 people during a three-week offensive, the Gaza health ministry said.
articles.title: Israeli strikes kill dozens in north Gaza as raid deepens, medics say

articles.author: John Geddie, Chang-Ran Kim
articles.description: The make-up of Japan's future government was in flux on Monday after voters punished Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba's ruling coalition, leaving no party with a clear mandate to lead the world's fourth-largest economy.
articles.title: Japan's government in flux after election gives no party majority

articles.author: Phil Stewart, Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: Hours after Iranian missiles rained down on Israel on Oct. 1, President Joe Biden's administration sent an urgent message to Israel: Take a breath.
articles.title: How Biden pushed Israel to calibrate its strikes on Iran

articles.author: Hyonhee Shin
articles.description: North Korea's defence ministry blamed South Korea's military for sending drones into its territory for political purposes, calling it an infringement upon the country's sovereignty, state media KCNA said on Monday.
articles.title: North Korea blames South's military for drone intrusion

articles.author: Steve Holland, Jeff Mason, James Oliphant
articles.description: Comedian Tony Hinchcliffe used crass language in joking that Latinos "love making babies" and called the Caribbean U.S. territory of Puerto Rico a "floating island of garbage."
articles.title: Trump rally at Madison Square Garden begins with vulgar, racist remarks from allies

articles.author: Ari Rabinovitch, Adam Makary
articles.description: Israel's airstrikes "hit hard" Iran's defences and missile production, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Sunday, but Iranian Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said the damage from Saturday's attack should not be exaggerated.
articles.title: Netanyahu says Israel hit Iran hard; Khamenei says damage should not be exaggerated

articles.author: Anthony Boadle
articles.description: Sao Paulo Mayor Ricardo Nunes was reelected on Sunday to serve another four years in Brazil's largest city, defeating leftist challenger Guilherme Boulos in municipal runoffs that confirmed a rightward swing by voters that could shape the country's 2026 presidential and congressional elections.
articles.title: Brazil runoff vote in city elections confirms right-wing trend

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said on Sunday that cooperation within the 'Ukraine plus Northern Europe' format is gaining speed with more steps that can increase pressure on Russia expected in the coming week.
articles.title: Zelenskiy says 'Ukraine plus Northern Europe' co-operation format gaining speed

articles.author: Guy Faulconbridge, Lidia Kelly
articles.description: Volodymyr Zelenskiy has been pleading with the West to allow Kyiv to fire deep into Russia with Western missiles.
articles.title: Putin says Moscow will respond if West helps Ukraine to strike deep into Russia

articles.author: Felix Light, Lucy Papachristou
articles.description: The Georgian Dream party received more than 54% of the vote in a parliamentary election on Saturday.
articles.title: Georgian ruling party wins election, near-complete results show
